content.question: Which feature of model 1 best illustrates how biological information is coded in a <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule?

choices.label: The <math alttext="5 prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext></mtext><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3 prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> labels at the ends of each strand
The labeling of the hydrogen bonds between base pairs
The lines connecting sugars and phosphate groups that represent covalent bonds
The linear sequence of the base pairs

content.answer: The linear sequence of the base pairs

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
